update.description:
* Renaming haptix_comm.props with haptix-comm.props
* New .bat script for helping with the SDK creation in Release mode. The zip version is now 8.2MB.
* Two .c files that will create a .mex file used by Matlab.
* Example Matlab controller.

There's still work to do for generating the mex files automatically.
update.title: Matlab wrapper

content.raw: Sounds good
content.html: Sounds good

content.raw: You are right, sorry for the quick commit, I've reverted it. @scpeters we will handle your suggestion on a separate pull request/issue. Thanks.
content.html: You are right, sorry for the quick commit, I've reverted it. @scpeters we will handle your suggestion on a separate pull request/issue. Thanks.

content.html: But I didn't try d0a0422

content.raw: Enough for now, thanks.

content.raw: Not sure about this change. It seems that we are pre-allocating the vector with zeros and inside the loop we are adding extra elements.
content.html: Not sure about this change. It seems that we are pre-allocating the vector with zeros and inside the loop we are adding extra elements.

content.raw: I checked that the Matlab controller was working on Octave. I'll test it on Matlab tomorrow.
content.html: I checked that the Matlab controller was working on Octave. I'll test it on Matlab tomorrow.

content.raw: I was able to compile the files with octave but no testing on MATLAB has been done. I'm going to merge and generate the packages but we should test this ASAP @caguero @gerkey
content.html: I was able to compile the files with octave but no testing on MATLAB has been done. I'm going to merge and generate the packages but we should test this ASAP @caguero @gerkey

content.raw: I'm always excited to commit your patches darling. Done 6e1e9f3.
content.html: I'm always excited to commit your patches darling. Done 6e1e9f3.

update.description:
* Renaming haptix_comm.props with haptix-comm.props
* New .bat script for helping with the SDK creation in Release mode. The zip version is now 8.2MB.
* Two .c files that will create a .mex file used by Matlab.
* Example Matlab controller.

There's still work to do for generating the mex files automatically.
update.title: Matlab wrapper

content.raw: ~~Actually, this may be how `hx_update` is supposed to work; feel free to disregard.~~ I was just excited to comment on matlab code.
content.html: Actually, this may be how hx_update is supposed to work; feel free to disregard. I was just excited to comment on matlab code.

It's faster to pre-allocate large vectors outside the loop: N = 2000; % Initialize the command scalar structure. cmd.ref_pos = zeros(N, 1); cmd.ref_vel = zeros(N, 1); cmd.gain_pos = zeros(N, 1); cmd.gain_vel = zeros(N, 1); for counter = 0:N-1 % Create a new command based on a sinusoidal wave. … pause(0.001); end Update: I misread the code, the counter loop is fine, but we can still pre-allocate the vectors.

while counter < 2000
  % Initialize the command scalar structure.
  cmd = struct();
  cmd.ref_pos = zeros(deviceInfo.nmotor, 1);
  cmd.ref_vel = cmd.ref_pos;
  cmd.gain_pos = cmd.ref_pos;
  cmd.gain_vel = cmd.ref_pos;
...

content.raw: probably doesn't matter, but we're trying to set a good example
content.html: probably doesn't matter, but we're trying to set a good example

content.raw: The size of the `prhs` array is `nrhs` and its value its checked (should be `1`). The change in d0a0422 should do that the loop iterates based on the size of ref_pos. It's not bulletproof but it's better.
content.html: The size of the prhs array is nrhs and its value its checked (should be 1). The change in d0a0422 should do that the loop iterates based on the size of ref_pos. It's not bulletproof but it's better.

content.raw: That was wrong. Fixed in d0a0422.
content.html: That was wrong. Fixed in d0a0422.

content.raw: Fixed in d0a0422
content.html: Fixed in d0a0422

content.raw: We could add an error message so the user knows about the problem.
content.html: We could add an error message so the user knows about the problem.

content.raw:
What about checking the size of the two arrays that we are using in the loop, `prhs` and `cmd.ref_pos` so we are sure that we are not accessing beyond the bounds of an array? 

```
if (sizeof(phrs) < hxMAXMOTOR)   // (or deviceInfo.nmotor?)
   exit
```

Does it make sense or it is guaranteed by the design at any point?
content.html:
What about checking the size of the two arrays that we are using in the loop, prhs and cmd.ref_pos so we are sure that we are not accessing beyond the bounds of an array? 

if (sizeof(phrs) < hxMAXMOTOR)   // (or deviceInfo.nmotor?)
   exit

Does it make sense or it is guaranteed by the design at any point?

content.raw: if we are able to have a deviceInfo (I don't see it in the code, is any kind of matlab magic bringing it to the scope? or we should call hx_getdeviceInfo?) seems like a very good idea.
content.html: if we are able to have a deviceInfo (I don't see it in the code, is any kind of matlab magic bringing it to the scope? or we should call hx_getdeviceInfo?) seems like a very good idea.

content.raw: Shouldn't we stop at `deviceInfo.nmotor`, instead of going to `hxMAXMOTOR`, to avoid sending or returning bogus data (or probably extra zeros)?
content.html: Shouldn't we stop at deviceInfo.nmotor, instead of going to hxMAXMOTOR, to avoid sending or returning bogus data (or probably extra zeros)?

content.raw: What happens if the caller gives you fewer values than you expect?  Looks like you could run off the end of `data` here.
content.html: What happens if the caller gives you fewer values than you expect? Looks like you could run off the end of data here.

content.raw: To set a good example, should we check the value of `res` here?
content.html: To set a good example, should we check the value of res here?
